--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Vladimir Ritz Bossicard <vladimir@b...>
wrote:
> > Just to quibble.. but I'd typically shorten that to:
> > 
> > public void testAdd() {
> >     assertEquals(3, new AddInt().add(1, 2));
> > }
> 
> I would summarize that by "do not rewrite your business logic in your 
> tests".  Go straight with examples ("I expect 3 when I pass 1 and 2 to 
> the add method"): it's easier to read/understand.

Well said!

Dave
